title.narrative: QUALITY INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Authorities at the national and subnational levels, communities and caregivers provide services and an environment conducive to the access of disadvantaged children, especially Roma, to quality, inclusive education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Authorities at the national and subnational levels, communities and caregivers provide services and an environment conducive to the access of disadvantaged children, especially Roma, to quality, inclusive education

description.narrative: UNICEF, together with the Government and NGO partners, generated quality evidence to promote inclusive, quality education | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2018

title.narrative: Instruments and good practices for preventing school dropout and absenteeism from School Attendance Initiative model integrated in national strategy for preventing early school leaving and national regulations.
Dropout rate in 32 schools targeted by the School Attendance Initiative model

actual.value: 2018:the dropout rate in primary education decreased by 50% as planned, and in secondary education by 14%

title.narrative: Absenteeism in educational units (pre-school, primary and lower secondary levels) included in the model in Bacau county, disaggregated by level of education.

actual.value: 2018:final data for 2017 will be available in mid 2018

title.narrative: School counsellors' role, responsibilities and work methodology, as part of the Minimum Package of Services, defined and agreed upon by MoE.

target.value: 2017:Role defined at national level by the MoE
